com.codename1.webrtc

Class ConstrainBoolean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codename1.webrtc.ConstrainBoolean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONStruct

    public class ConstrainBoolean
extends Object
implements JSONStruct

    The ConstrainBoolean dictionary is used to specify a constraint for a property whose value is a Boolean value. You can specify an exact value which must be matched, an ideal value that should be matched if at all possible, and a fallback value to attempt to match once all more specific constraints have been applied.

    See Also:
    https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ConstrainBoolean

        public Object toJSONStruct()
        Description copied from interface: JSONStruct

        Converts the object to a JSON structure. A JSON structure may be a list, map, string, boolean, or number. Lists and maps may only contain values that are themselves JSON structures.
